Description: Detected a Generic API Key, potentially exposing access to various services and sensitive operations.
Author: Andrew J Schmitt
Message:
Add git credential forwarding for container-to-host authentication (#50)

* Add git credential forwarding for container-to-host authentication

Forward host git credentials to containers following the VSCode DevContainers
pattern. Enables seamless git operations without manual credential setup.

Features:
- HTTPS credential forwarding via host proxy (/git/credential endpoint)
- SSH agent socket forwarding (macOS Docker Desktop + Linux SSH_AUTH_SOCK)
- Host ~/.gitconfig copying with credential.helper filtering
- Zero-config defaults when host git is configured

New files:
- internal/hostproxy/git_credential.go: Credential handler
- internal/workspace/ssh.go: SSH agent mount helpers
- internal/workspace/gitconfig.go: Gitconfig mount helpers
- pkg/build/templates/git-credential-clawker.sh: Container credential helper

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>

* Fix git credential forwarding error handling and code duplication

- Rewrite git-credential-clawker.sh to use jq for JSON parsing instead
  of fragile sed patterns that failed on escaped quotes
- Add proper curl error handling with stderr capture and HTTP status check
- Return exit 1 on credential lookup failure (git expects non-zero)
- Extract duplicated git credential setup code from run.go and create.go
  into new workspace.SetupGitCredentials() helper
- Add warnings in entrypoint.sh for silent failures (firewall, gitconfig,
  credential helper configuration)
- Add scanner.Err() check in git_credential.go parseGitCredentialOutput()
- Improve comments for macOS SSH agent check and action-to-subcommand mapping

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>

* squeezing in unrelated change

* Add SSH known hosts for GitHub, GitLab, and Bitbucket

Pre-populate ~/.ssh/known_hosts with official public keys when SSH agent
forwarding is enabled, fixing "Host key verification failed" errors for
git+ssh operations. Matches VS Code Dev Containers behavior.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>

* added ssh known hosts for most popular scm providers.

* fixed spacing

* Add SSH agent forwarding via host proxy for macOS

On macOS with Docker Desktop, the SSH agent socket is mounted with root
ownership, causing permission errors. This change adds SSH agent forwarding
through the host proxy to work around this issue.

New components:
- internal/hostproxy/ssh_agent.go: HTTP handler for /ssh/agent endpoint
- cmd/ssh-agent-proxy: Go binary that creates user-owned socket and proxies
  SSH agent requests to the host via HTTP
- pkg/build/templates/ssh-agent-proxy.go: Embedded source for Docker build

Changes:
- Dockerfile.tmpl: Multi-stage build to compile ssh-agent-proxy
- entrypoint.sh: Start proxy when CLAWKER_SSH_VIA_PROXY=true
- ssh.go: macOS no longer mounts Docker Desktop socket directly
- git.go: Set CLAWKER_SSH_VIA_PROXY env var on macOS

Linux continues to use direct socket mounting which works reliably.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>

* Fix PR review issues for git credential forwarding

Addresses review feedback with shell script fixes, test coverage, and documentation updates:

- Fix clawker.yaml schema (move git_credentials under security)
- Fix entrypoint.sh SSH agent proxy startup verification with proper exit checks
- Fix entrypoint.sh gitconfig filtering using awk to filter entire [credential] section
- Fix git-credential-clawker.sh silent jq failures with exit status checks
- Add HTTP status check in ssh-agent-proxy.go forwardToProxy()
- Remove duplicate cmd/ssh-agent-proxy/ (template version in pkg/build/templates used)
- Add comprehensive tests for hostproxy handlers and workspace helpers
- Add tests for GitCredentialsConfig methods (GitHTTPSEnabled, GitSSHEnabled, CopyGitConfigEnabled)
- Update CLAUDE.md to remove deleted directory and fix SSH handler description

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>

* fixes memory

---------

Co-authored-by: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>

Description: Detected a Generic API Key, potentially exposing access to various services and sensitive operations.
Author: Andrew J Schmitt
Message:
A/design update (#22)

* doc tweaks

* Architecture redesign:
- Created comprehensive new architecture and implementation plan
- Implemented phase 1

* removing claude local settings

* revamp of engine to use a decorator pattern

* removed old test commends.

* fixes. updated design
